metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3449 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Open vSwitch 1.4.2 uses world writable permissions for (1) /var/lib/openvswitch/pki/controllerca/incoming/ and (2) /var/lib/openvswitch/pki/switchca/incoming/, which allows local users to delete and overwrite arbitrary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-controller - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-datapath-dkms - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-datapath-source - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-ipsec - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-pki - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-switch - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
openvswitch-test - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
ovsdbmonitor - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
python-openvswitch - 1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2+git20120612-9ubuntu3').
